709286f-b.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Carmine Street.
709286f-b.text:
(1)
New Nos. 305-303-301 Sixth Avenue (right) and 5, 7-13, 15
Carmine Street (left), west side, OpDosite the western end
of Minetta Lane. This picture was taken during the construction
of the City subway and the extension of Sixth Avenue south
to Church and Franklin Streets.
October 11, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
305-303, 301 (formerly 3,3, 1) Sixth Avenue and 5, 7-9 Carmine
Street, four years later, emphasising the corner house, 5
Carmiine Street -- 301 Sixth Avenue, an old frame house with
a brick front.
1932.
The J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
CREDIT LIE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
709286f-b.folder: Manhattan : 6th Avenue & Carmine Street., Manhattan, NY

709275f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - Minetta Street.
709275f-a.text:
Sixth Ave., north from Minetta Street (right) and showing empty lots
lining the east side of same. These were left when this southern extension
of the Ave. was projected. The Sixth Ave. Elevated is seen making an
eastward turn on West 3rd Street. In the distance appears the Empire
State Building. This set of 3 views shows details of the same area.
September 18, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

709275f-b.text:

718112f-a.title: Manhattan: Carmine Street - 6th Avenue
718112f-a.text:
(1)
Carmine Street, north side, west from Sixth Avenue and Minetta
Lane, not including No. 5 Carmine Street, the first house. Taken
during the construction of the new city subway and the extension
of Sixth Avenue south to Franklin Street, this view shows the
cleared S.E. corner of Carmine and Bleecker Streets, and the new
church of Our Lady of Pompeii on the N.W. corner, completed early
in 1927 to replace the old church.
October 11, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Carmine Street, north side, west from and including Sixth
Avenue and Minetta Lane. The first Carmine Street house is No. 5,
the Carmine Street side of the brick-covered frame 301 (old No. 1)
Sixth Avenue.
March 15, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same as No. 1, as Viewed northward from Minetta Street and
across Sixth Ave. South. The apartment house on the left is at the
S.W. corner of Bleecker and Carmine Streets; upon the first it bears
No. 228-232 and the latter No. 22.
September 18, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

709278f-b.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - Minetta Street.
709278f-b.text:
(1)
Sixth Ave. (Extension), east side, north from Minetta Street, show-
ing clearance from Minetta Street to Minetta Lane. Also seen is the
Sixth Ave. Elevated Line on West 3rd Street, making a sharp bend, to con-
tinue northward on Sixth Ave.
May 29, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, including the west side of Sixth Ave., showing a play-
ground on the former clearance.
October 29, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

709278f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - Minetta Street.

721652f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - Minetta Street
721652f-a.text:
Sixth Avenue, east side, between Minetta Street and
Minetta Lane, showinm in the open foreground area
the site of the garden court, Minetta Place. Exten-
sion of the Avenue and related demolition caused this
Greenwich Village feature of yore to disappear. Shortly
two modern apartment houses will rise here. One to the
right and one to the left of the dwellings, the rears of
which are in the center. Incidently, these will remain,
facing as they do, on Minetta Street. The tenement at
the right is on the opposite side of this street.
About 1939
Alexander Alland, photo
NO REPRODUCTIONS

709289f-a.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Carmine Street.
709289f-a.text:
South end of Sixth Averme at Carmine Street before its extension
to Church Street.
Aril, 1925.
Brown Brothers, Photographer.
NO REPhODUCT1ONS.

709288f-a.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Carmine Street.
709288f-a.text:
(1)
South end of Sixth Avenue, at Carmine Street.
Sixth Avenue has now been extended to Church Street.
July 31, 1926.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
Foot of Sixth Avenue, west side,. At this date,
Sixth Avenue's southern extremity was at Carmine
Street.
It has now been extended to Church Street.
October 11, 1928.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
NO REPnODUCTIONS.
(3)
Across Sixth Avenue wreckage from Carmine Street.
May 12, 1927.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.
NO REPnODDCTIONS.
709288f-a.folder: Manhattan : 6th Avenue & Carmine Street., Manhattan, NY

721649f-a.title: Manhattan: Minetta Lane - 6th Avenue
721649f-a.text:
Minetta Lane, east from 6th Avenue to MacDougal Street. At
the right is a clearance across which appear the rears of build-
ings at the S. W. corner of Minetta Lane and Street. These are
to be removed for a new 6-story apartment house according to the
N. Y. Times of December 16, 1939.
April 13, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

709285f-a.title: Manhattan : 6th Avenue - Carmine Street.
709285f-a.text:
1-5 Sixth Ave., (Now known as Nos. 3O1-305) at, adioiing and north
of the N.W. corner of Carmine Street. No. 1 Sixth Ave., is a 3-story
frame house.
About 1914.
93E~55~:8E.
REPRODUCED.

709279f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - Minetta Street.
709279f-a.text:
Sixth Ave., east side, north from Minetta Street, showing grassy
plots upon which were buildings prior to the extension of Sixth Ave.,
from Minetta Lane south to Church Street. The elongated 3-story structure
on the right, that apparently faces Sixth Ave. is No. 2 Minetta Lane.
Minetta Place, an enclosed Court im the center of this block formerly
was in the foreground; the northern extremity of which is shown enclosed
by a fence in views 2 and 3.
September 18, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
